trans-unit.source:
This captures a block of code that is similar to a .NET method body.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxxx x xxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx x .XXX xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the body of the lambda expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the lambda expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the parameters of the lambda expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the return type of the lambda expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the value that indicates if the lambda expression will be compiled with the tail call optimization.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

True if the lambda expression will be compiled with the tail call optimization, otherwise false.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Produces a delegate that represents the lambda expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
